info.name: RGS - Remote Gaming Server
info.description:
End-to-end integration tests for the Remote Gaming Server based on GLI-19 compliance standards.

## Prerequisites
**Important:** Users must be created before running these tests. The RGS does not expose a public registration API.

Create test users via the auth service or database before running tests.

## GLI-19 Compliance Features
- **Player Limits (§2.5.5)**: Deposit, wager, and loss limits
- **Self-Exclusion (§2.5.5)**: Temporary and permanent self-exclusion
- **Gaming Control (§2.4)**: System-wide and per-game/player enable/disable
- **Interrupted Games (§4.16)**: Resume, void, or refund interrupted games

## Usage
1. Set the `base_url` variable to your RGS server URL
2. Set `test_username` and `test_password` to valid credentials
3. Each folder can be run independently

item.description:
Player limits for responsible gaming.

**GLI-19 §2.5.5** - Limitations and Exclusions

Tests cover:
- Setting deposit limits (daily, weekly, monthly)
- Setting wager limits
- Setting loss limits
- Limit decreases are immediate
- Limit increases require 24-hour cooling off period

item.name: Self-Exclusion (GLI-19 §2.5.5)
item.description:
Self-exclusion for responsible gaming.

**GLI-19 §2.5.5.c** - Self-Exclusion

Tests cover:
- Check exclusion status
- Temporary self-exclusion (with duration)
- Permanent self-exclusion
- Excluded player cannot access gaming

item.name: Gaming Control (GLI-19 §2.4)
item.description:
Gaming control for system management.

**GLI-19 §2.4** - Gaming Management

Tests cover:
- Get system status
- Disable/enable all gaming system-wide
- Disable/enable specific games
- Disable/enable specific players

**Requires admin_token** for authentication.

item.name: Interrupted Games (GLI-19 §4.16)
item.description:
Interrupted game handling for game recovery.

**GLI-19 §4.16** - Interrupted Games

Tests cover:
- List interrupted games for player
- Resume interrupted game
- Void interrupted game (with refund)
- Get details of specific interrupted game
